content: in this legal case two parties referred to as žg and ag were involved in a divorce they had joint assets including an apartment a cottage and a car žg filed a claim asking the court to decide on the use of these assets specifically requesting to continue living in the apartment the court ruled that žgs claim should be dismissed and ags counterclaim should be satisfied the court ordered the termination of joint ownership of the apartment and the cottage and they will be sold at a public auction the proceeds from the sale will be divided equally between žg and ag both parties will bear their own procedural costs except for a state fee of 30000 euros paid by žg the court also stated that the parties have the right to appeal the decision within 30 days the court considered the evidence and legal arguments presented by both parties as well as the relevant sections of the civil procedure code and the family law act the court found that the joint assets of the parties ended when the divorce decree entered into force the court determined that the joint assets should be divided according to the law with the apartment being sold at a public auction the court dismissed the claim and satisfied the counterclaim the court also stated that the procedural costs would be borne by the parties except for the state fee the court ordered žg to pay the unpaid state fee of 30000 euros

metadata.cost: Each party covers own procedural costs, unspecified amounts
